Interface amm.mail.MailSink 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Interface amm.mail.MailSink

public interface MailSink
extends Object
An interface to be implemented by classes that receive e-mail via POPHandlers. When a POPHandler is started, it runs through all pending actions, and then closes the connection. Thus, the MailSink needs to start a new POPHandler when there is not one currently running but a some new action is required. The MailSink must pass the POPHandler a PipedOutputStream before retrieving any messages.
See Also:
POPHandler

DEL_ALL
The flag indicating that all messages should be removed from the POP3 server.
DELETE
The flag indicating that one or more messages should be removed from the POP3 server.
GET_ALL
The flag indicating that all mail should be retrieved from the POP3 server.
GET_NEW
The flag indicating that all new mail should be retrieved from the POP3 server.
UPDATE
The flag indicating that the list of available messages should be updated.

delWhich()
When a DELETE action is called for, the POPHandler uses this to determine which messages should be removed.
handlerDone()
Signifies that the POPHandler has finished, and any new actions need to be carried out by a new POPHandler.
numThere(int)
The POPHandler uses this to tell the MailSink how many messages are waiting on the server.
pop3Host()
Returns the address of the POP3 server the POPHandler should connect to.
pop3Pass()
Returns the password for the account on the POP3 server.
pop3User()
Returns the user name for the account on the POP3 server.
remove()
Returns a boolean indicating whether messages read from the POP3 server should be subsequently removed from the server.
runNext()
Returns an integer indicating the next action to be taken by the POPHandler.
status(String)
Receives status messages from the POPHandler.
verify(String, int)
Returns an integer specifying the position of the message in the mail client's list of known messages.

UPDATE 
  public final static int UPDATE
The flag indicating that the list of available messages should be updated.
GET_ALL 
  public final static int GET_ALL
The flag indicating that all mail should be retrieved from the POP3 server.
GET_NEW 
  public final static int GET_NEW
The flag indicating that all new mail should be retrieved from the POP3 server.
DELETE 
  public final static int DELETE
The flag indicating that one or more messages should be removed from the POP3 server.
DEL_ALL 
  public final static int DEL_ALL
The flag indicating that all messages should be removed from the POP3 server.

pop3Host 
  public abstract String pop3Host()
Returns the address of the POP3 server the POPHandler should connect to.
Returns:
The desired address.
pop3User 
  public abstract String pop3User()
Returns the user name for the account on the POP3 server.
Returns:
The desired user name.
pop3Pass 
  public abstract String pop3Pass()
Returns the password for the account on the POP3 server.
Returns:
The desired password.
numThere 
  public abstract void numThere(int num)
The POPHandler uses this to tell the MailSink how many messages are waiting on the server.
Parameters:
num - The number of messages waiting.
remove 
  public abstract boolean remove()
Returns a boolean indicating whether messages read from the POP3 server should be subsequently removed from the server.
Returns:
True if the messages should be removed.
status 
  public abstract void status(String msg)
Receives status messages from the POPHandler. status typically displays the messages to a status bar or the Standard Output.
Parameters:
msg - The message from the POPHandler.
verify 
  public abstract int verify(String msgId,
                             int last)
Returns an integer specifying the position of the message in the mail client's list of known messages. If the result is not found, the message is considered to be new. The position of the last message found can be used to speed searches.
Parameters:
msgId - The SMTP ID of the message on the server.
last - The position of the last message found; -1 should cause the search to start at the beginning.
Returns:
The position of the message, or -1 if the message was not found.
runNext 
  public abstract int runNext()
Returns an integer indicating the next action to be taken by the POPHandler.
Returns:
One of the flags declared above.
handlerDone 
  public abstract void handlerDone()
Signifies that the POPHandler has finished, and any new actions need to be carried out by a new POPHandler.
delWhich 
  public abstract String[] delWhich()
When a DELETE action is called for, the POPHandler uses this to determine which messages should be removed.
Returns:
SMTP IDs of messages to be removed, one at each element of the array.
